Finding Scholarly Articles

Posted by The WI+RE Team on January 11, 2010

Ready to get the most out of your article search? This tutorial will help you successfully navigate search filters, construct effective searches, and download the full texts of your articles!

Give it a try:

Visit your favorite database, or www.library.ucla.edu/#databases, and get searching! Use the tips you learned in the video to make sure that your search is neither too broad nor too narrow!

Tips:

  • starsUse synonyms or asterisks to broaden your search.
  • starsUse search filters and sorting options to narrow your search.
  • starsUse opposite search terms to find out if some authors have found conflicting results.
  • ondemand_videoFor more help on turning your questions into keywords:
  • forumWant to talk about it? Set up a free research consultation to get help with research guides:

    Ask a librarian 24/7 chat service.

    Set up a research consultation at a UCLA Library.
